info.description: This event publishing API can be used to publish shipping events to the platform. The platform will distribute this information to other participants that have been nominated to be involved in the consignment.
info.title: Event Publish API

post.description:
Updates the consignment with the bill of lading number. 

The carrierBookingNumber, the billOfLadingnumber, and the list of transport equipment are required. 

If the consignment does not exist, it is created, and if the transport equipment referenced do not exist then they will also be created.

The eBLProvider field will be used by non TradeLens e-BL systems to notify that an e-BL (outside of TradeLens) was issued for this consignment.

post.description:
Bill of lading number is available. Updates the consignment with the bill of lading number if it does not have one.

This event requires either a consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber to identify the consignment.

post.description:
Associates a subcontracted consignment as a child of another consignment.  

Must submit either a consignmentId or a carrierBookingNumber to identify the parent consignment. 

Must submit either a subcontractId or, a subcontractCBN and subcontractBOL to identify the child consignment.

post.description:
Grants a participant a role in a consignment or transport equipment. The role determines the participant's access privileges within the consignment and associated transport equipment.

This event requires either a consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber to identify the consignment. This event requires either an orgId or a partyRef.

Parties with the role TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER or TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER may use this to grant visibility of a consignment to their onboarded parties.TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER can add a party with any role except TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER. TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER can add a party with any role except TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER or TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER. The partyRole TITLE_HOLDER is for internal TradeLens use only.

Subscribers that receive this event are notified that a party has been  added. The information that identifies the party will not be included, unless the party reference is in valid UUID format.

These roles are deprecated and should no longer be used: OCEAN_CARRIER, TRANSSHIPMENT_TERMINAL, ORIGIN_3PL, DESTINATION_3PL, INLAND_TERMINAL, RAIL_OPERATOR, TRUCK_OPERATOR, BARGE_OPERATOR, FEEDER, PARTICIPANT_BANK

post.description:
Updates the list of organizations associated with a consignment. This grants the organizations the ability to view the consignment, its transport equipment, and their events based on the organization’s role and according to the permission matrix (data sharing specification).

This event requires either a consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber to identify the consignment.  This event requires either an orgId or a partyRef.

Parties with the role TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER or TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER may use this to grant visibility of a consignment to their onboarded parties. TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER can add a party with any role except TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER. TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER can add a party with any role except TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER or TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER. The partyRole TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER cannot be removed. The partyRole TITLE_HOLDER is for internal TradeLens use only.

Subscribers that receive this event are notified that a party has been  updated. The information that identifies the party will not be included, unless the party reference is in valid UUID format.

These roles are deprecated and should no longer be used: OCEAN_CARRIER, TRANSSHIPMENT_TERMINAL, ORIGIN_3PL, DESTINATION_3PL, INLAND_TERMINAL, RAIL_OPERATOR, TRUCK_OPERATOR, BARGE_OPERATOR, FEEDER, PARTICIPANT_BANK

post.description:
Dissociates an organization from a consignment. This removes the ability of the organization to view the consignment, its transport equipment, and their events. This event requires either a consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber to identify the consignment. This event requires either an orgId or a partyRef.

Parties with the role TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER or TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER may use this to remove visibility of a consignment to their onboarded parties. The partyRole TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER cannot be removed. The partyRole TITLE_HOLDER is for internal TradeLens use only.

Subscribers that receive this event are notified that a party has been  removed. The information that identifies the party will not be included, unless the party reference is in valid UUID format.

These roles are deprecated and should no longer be used: OCEAN_CARRIER, TRANSSHIPMENT_TERMINAL, ORIGIN_3PL, DESTINATION_3PL, INLAND_TERMINAL, RAIL_OPERATOR, TRUCK_OPERATOR, BARGE_OPERATOR, FEEDER, PARTICIPANT_BANK

post.description:
Sets a reference identifier for the consignment. A consignment can have multiple reference numbers, and submitting this event multiple times will result in multiple references being added to the consignment. Reference numbers allow participants to search based on identifiers that have meaning to them, like a PO number. 

This event requires submission of either consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber.

Please be aware that adding a reference via this API does not create an obligation for the Transport Service Provider or any other participant in the consignment to consume the reference number in its own internal systems or use that reference number in any communications with you or other parties outside the TradeLens platform.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: See Model to the right for the full description of the event. Note that the Example Value is *not* a comprehensive list of all fields in the event. It is a subset meant to provide a minimum working example of the event.

post.description:
Completely replaces an existing reference list previously added by an organization. The references is the publisher's representation of the consignment, using one or more industry standard reference types. Multiple references can be registered against the same consignment. The references are applied to the trade object and will become visible and searchable by all participants that are permissioned to access it.

Please be aware that adding a reference via this API does not create an obligation for the Transport Service Provider or any other participant in the transport equipment tracking to consume the reference number in its own internal systems or use that reference number in any communications with you or other parties outside the TradeLens platform.

This event requires submission of either consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber. 

A list of supported reference types can be retrieved from Platform Constants /referenceTypes API

post.description:
Removes one or more reference identifier, which were previously added by an organization to a consignment. The references will be removed from the specific trade object, no longer being visible and searchable by other participants.

This event requires submission of either consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber. 

A list of supported reference types can be retrieved from Platform Constants /referenceTypes API

This event requires a Consignment Identifier (consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber). You may only specify one. A billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct consignment.

post.description:
Updates the consignment with the bill of lading number. 

The carrierBookingNumber, the billOfLadingnumber, and the list of transport equipment are required. 

If the consignment does not exist, it is created, and if the transport equipment referenced do not exist then they will also be created.

NOTE: This is exposed in Swagger exclusively for the purpose of helping subscribers understand the schema of the events that will be published. This event is generated by the platform internally when documents are uploaded through Document Sharing or Actionable Flows APIs. This API cannot be called directly and will return a 403 Forbidden HTTP Status Code and the event will not be processed.

post.description:
Standardized document event that accepts different types of documents (ie. billOfLading, commercialInvoice, etc) as well as an "action" type (submitted, approved, rejected, canceled). 

Documents that have additional attributes can be added in the list of "docReferences" where each "referenceName" and "referenceValue" is a pair. 

For example, a referenceName of "billOfLadingNumber" and referenceValue of "BOL8331939" is valid. 

NOTE: If a referenceName of "billOfLadingNumber" is being sent, it must be camel case as shown in the previous example. This event requires either a transportEquipmentId, a consignmentId, or a shipmentId. You must specify exactly one type of identifier.

NOTE: This is exposed in Swagger exclusively for the purpose of helping subscribers understand the schema of the events that will be published. This event is generated by the platform internally when documents are uploaded through Document Sharing or Actionable Flows APIs. This API cannot be called directly and will return a 403 Forbidden HTTP Status Code and the event will not be processed.

post.description:
Bill of lading has been surrendered to the carrier. 

This event requires either a Transport Equipment identifier (transportEquipmentId or transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber) or a Consignment Identifier (consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber). You must specify one type of identifier or the other. If a transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber are specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

When specifying a location, either the type/value field pair can be used, or any of the other location fields (unlocode, address, smdgTerminal, geoCoord, splc, gln), but not both. Any combination of the other location fields is supported. However, they must all refer to the same location. There is no cross check validation for the fields.

The eBLProvider field will be used by non TradeLens e-BL systems to notify that an e-BL (outside of TradeLens) has been surrendered to the carrier.

post.description:
All Import Conditions for the release of the cargo at the destination country, including carrier release, customs release and terminal release (indication that the transport equipment is ready to be picked up), have been met. 

  Note that this is a distinct event from the Terminal Release. 

This event requires a Transport Equipment identifier (transportEquipmentId or transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber). You must specify one of these identifiers. If a transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber are specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

When specifying a location, either the type/value field pair can be used, or any of the other location fields (unlocode, address, smdgTerminal, geoCoord, splc, gln), but not both. Any combination of the other location fields is supported. However, they must all refer to the same location. There is no cross check validation for the fields.

post.description:
One or more transport equipments are available to be picked up from a location via truck, notifying the involved actors of the readiness of the transport equipment availability. The common usage types include: When full status “empty”, either indicates that Empty Container is available at Origin Depot or Destination Warehouse (after stripping). When full status “full”, the full container is available at Destination Maritime Terminal or at Origin Warehouse (after stuffing). 

This event requires either a Transport Equipment identifier (transportEquipmentId or transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber) or a Consignment Identifier (consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber). You must specify one type of identifier or the other. If a transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber are specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

When specifying a location, either the type/value field pair can be used, or any of the other location fields (unlocode, address, smdgTerminal, geoCoord, splc, gln), but not both. Any combination of the other location fields is supported. However, they must all refer to the same location. There is no cross check validation for the fields.

This event requires the eventOccurrenceTime8601.

* When sent at a Consignment level, with only CBN or consignmentId, the transportEquipmentDetails array can be used to report how many and type of containers are ready for pick up. 

* When sent at a TransportEquipment level, by providing equipmentNumber or the other identifiers, the actual equipment identification is expected, but not the equipmentQuantity Array.

post.description:
Indicates the latest date and time by which one of the below export processess must be met by the actor arranging the transportation of the goods:

(1) Documentation: Export documentation such as Shipping Instruction and customs advanced manifest such as AES, must be delivered to the carrier.

(2) VGM: The SOLAS Verified Gross Mass (VGM) must be filled with the carrier. Normally provided by carriers at time of Booking Confirmation or on Vessel Schedules.

(3) Cargo: The transport equipment must be delivered to the terminal at the origin port of load location, so it can be loaded on the scheduled vessel; provided by either the carrier or the Terminal where the transport equipment will load. Also known as Physical or Terminal/Cargo Closing.

This event requires either a Transport Equipment identifier (transportEquipmentId or transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber) or a Consignment Identifier (consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber). You must specify one type of identifier or the other. If a transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber are specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

When specifying a location, either the type/value field pair can be used, or any of the other location fields (unlocode, address, smdgTerminal, geoCoord, splc, gln), but not both. Any combination of the other location fields is supported. However, they must all refer to the same location. There is no cross check validation for the fields.

The field 'terminal' and the location 'smdgTerminal' field are both ways to reference a terminal using the SMDG standard. When both are specified, the location 'smdgTerminal' field will take precedence. The 'terminal' field will be ignored.

post.description:
Used to specify the temperature setting which the goods are (to be) shipped or stored, during the entire transportation cycle.  

Temperature provision conventions: A minus (-) must be used to indicate negative temperature, always in the first position of the value attribute. Positive temperature must be unsigned. A dot (.) must be used as decimal separator. 

If a minimum and maximum temperature range is not available, use only minTemp as the set temperature.

If a minimum and maximum temperature range is not available, use only minTemp as the set temperature.

post.description:
Associates a party to a shipment. This grants the party the ability to view the shipment and its events. The party also receives permission to documents associated with the shipment, based on the party's role and according to the permission matrix (data sharing specification). 

This event requires a shipmentReference to identify the shipment. This event requires at least one shipmentParty. 

Subscribers that receive this event are notified that a party has been  added. The information that identifies the party will not be included, unless the party reference is in valid UUID format.

Add references to a shipment. Note that the combination of shipmentRef and shipmentRefType must be unique within the scope of a given reference owner. 

A list of supported reference types can be retrieved from Platform Constants /referenceTypes API

Please be aware that adding a reference via this API does not create an obligation for the Transport Service Provider or any other participant in the consignment to consume the reference number in its own internal systems or use that reference number in any communications with you or other parties outside the TradeLens platform.

post.description:
Associates transport equipment with another participant, enabling carriers to grant visibility of transport equipment to their onboarded parties, enabling those participants to view the TE and its data. This event requires submission of either transportEquipmentId, transportEquipmentRef, or equipmentNumber. If an equipmentNumber or transportEquipmentRef is specified, a carrierBookingNumber may also be included.

Parties with the role TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER or TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER may use this to grant visibility of a transport equipment to their onboarded parties. TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER can add a party with any role except TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER. TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER can add a party with any role except TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER or TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER. The partyRole TITLE_HOLDER is for internal TradeLens use only.

Subscribers that receive this event are notified that a party has been  added. The information that identifies the party will not be included, unless the party reference is in valid UUID format.

These roles are deprecated and should no longer be used: OCEAN_CARRIER, TRANSSHIPMENT_TERMINAL, ORIGIN_3PL, DESTINATION_3PL, INLAND_TERMINAL, RAIL_OPERATOR, TRUCK_OPERATOR, BARGE_OPERATOR, FEEDER, PARTICIPANT_BANK

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: See Model to the right for the full description of the event. Note that the Example Value is *not* a comprehensive list of all fields in the event. It is a subset meant to provide a minimum working example of the event.

post.description:
Replaces the list of organizations associated with a transport equipment. This grants the specified organizations the ability to view the transport equipment and its events. The organization also receives permission to documents associated with the transport equipment, based on the organization’s role according to the permission matrix (data sharing specification).

This event requires submission of either transportEquipmentId, transportEquipmentRef, or equipmentNumber. If an equipmentNumber or transportEquipmentRef is specified, a carrierBookingNumber may also be included. This event requires either an orgId or a partyRef.

Parties with the role TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER or TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER may use this to grant visibility of a transport equipment to their onboarded parties. TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER can add a party with any role except TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER. TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER can add a party with any role except TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER or TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER. The partyRole TITLE_HOLDER is for internal TradeLens use only.

Subscribers that receive this event are notified that a party has been  updated. The information that identifies the party will not be included, unless the party reference is in valid UUID format.

These roles are deprecated and should no longer be used: OCEAN_CARRIER, TRANSSHIPMENT_TERMINAL, ORIGIN_3PL, DESTINATION_3PL, INLAND_TERMINAL, RAIL_OPERATOR, TRUCK_OPERATOR, BARGE_OPERATOR, FEEDER, PARTICIPANT_BANK

post.description:
Dissociates a transport equipment from an organization. This removes the ability of the organization to view the transport equipment and its events. This event requires submission of either transportEquipmentId, transportEquipmentRef, or equipmentNumber. If an equipmentNumber or transportEquipmentRef is specified, a carrierBookingNumber may also be included. This event requires either an orgId or a partyRef.

Parties with the role TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER or TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER may use this to remove visibility of a transport equipment to their onboarded parties. TRANSPORT_SERVICE_BUYER can remove a party with any role except TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER. The role of TRANSPORT_SERVICE_PROVIDER cannot be removed. The partyRole TITLE_HOLDER is for internal TradeLens use only.

Subscribers that receive this event are notified that a party has been  removed. The information that identifies the party will not be included, unless the party reference is in valid UUID format.

These roles are deprecated and should no longer be used: OCEAN_CARRIER, TRANSSHIPMENT_TERMINAL, ORIGIN_3PL, DESTINATION_3PL, INLAND_TERMINAL, RAIL_OPERATOR, TRUCK_OPERATOR, BARGE_OPERATOR, FEEDER, PARTICIPANT_BANK

post.description:
Used to add reference numbers to an instance of Transport Equipment. Multiple references can be registered against the same Transport Equipment. 

This event requires either a transportEquipmentId or equipmentNumber, and a transportEquipmentRef. If an equipmentNumber is specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

Please be aware that adding a reference via this API does not create an obligation for the Transport Service Provider or any other participant in the consignment to consume the reference number in its own internal systems or use that reference number in any communications with you or other parties outside the TradeLens platform.

parameters.description: See Model to the right for the full description of the event. Note that the Example Value is *not* a comprehensive list of all fields in the event. It is a subset meant to provide a minimum working example of the event.

post.description:
Completely replaces an existing reference list previously added by an organization. The references is the publisher's representation of the transport equipment using one or more industry standard reference types. Multiple references can be registered against the same transport equipment. The references are applied to the trade object and will become visible and searchable by all participants that are permissioned to access it.

Please be aware that adding a reference via this API does not create an obligation for the Transport Service Provider or any other participant in the transport equipment tracking to consume the reference number in its own internal systems or use that reference number in any communications with you or other parties outside the TradeLens platform.

This event requires either a transportEquipmentId or equipmentNumber. If an equipmentNumber is specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

A list of supported reference types can be retrieved from Platform Constants /referenceTypes API

post.description:
Removes one or more reference identifier, which were previously added by an organization to a transport equipment. The references will be removed from the specific trade object, no longer being visible and searchable by other participants.

This event requires either a transportEquipmentId or equipmentNumber. If an equipmentNumber is specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

A list of supported reference types can be retrieved from Platform Constants /referenceTypes API

post.description:
The notification that the packed transport equipment has arrived by barge at a location. 

This event requires a Transport Equipment identifier (transportEquipmentId or transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber). You must specify one of these identifiers. If a transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber are specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

If fullStatus is 'empty' and a carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber are not specified, the event will not be processed.

This event requires the eventOccurrenceTime8601.

When specifying a location, either the type/value field pair can be used, or any of the other location fields (unlocode, address, smdgTerminal, geoCoord, splc, gln), but not both. Any combination of the other location fields is supported. However, they must all refer to the same location. There is no cross check validation for the fields.

The field 'terminal' and the location 'smdgTerminal' field are both ways to reference a terminal using the SMDG standard. When both are specified, the location 'smdgTerminal' field will take precedence. The 'terminal' field will be ignored.

post.description:
The actual time of departure of the packed transport equipment from a terminal, based on vessel departure from a berth. 

This event requires a Transport Equipment identifier (transportEquipmentId or transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber). You must specify one of these identifiers. If a transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber are specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

If fullStatus is 'empty' and a carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber are not specified, the event will not be processed.

 This event requires the eventOccurrenceTime8601.

When specifying a location, either the type/value field pair can be used, or any of the other location fields (unlocode, address, smdgTerminal, geoCoord, splc, gln), but not both. Any combination of the other location fields is supported. However, they must all refer to the same location. There is no cross check validation for the fields.

The field 'terminal' and the location 'smdgTerminal' field are both ways to reference a terminal using the SMDG standard. When both are specified, the location 'smdgTerminal' field will take precedence. The 'terminal' field will be ignored.

post.description:
The estimated arrival time of the transport equipment at a location via truck, including all estimated gate in events, both on export and import side and for full and empty transport equipment truck moves. The common types of such moves include: 

* Estimated time of arrival of empty transport equipment for export load at stuffing site 

* Estimated time of arrival of full transport equipment at export terminal 

* Estimated time of arrival of packed transport equipment at import inland stripping location 

* Actual time of arrival of empty transport equipment at depot (terminal or inland location) after stripping. 

This event requires a Transport Equipment identifier (transportEquipmentId or transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber). You must specify one of these identifiers. If a transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber are specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

The field 'terminal' and the location 'smdgTerminal' field are both ways to reference a terminal using the SMDG standard. When both are specified, the location 'smdgTerminal' field will take precedence. The 'terminal' field will be ignored.

post.description:
The estimated time that the transport equipment will be loaded onto a truck, i.e., the time that a transport equipment, mounted on a chassis, will be attached to a truck. It includes all estimated loading on events, both on the export and import side and for full and empty transport equipment. The common types of such moves include: 

* Empty transport equipment loaded onto truck on way to stuffing site 

* Full transport equipment loaded on truck on its way to a terminal 

* Full transport equipment loaded on truck on its way to being stripped. 

This event requires a Transport Equipment identifier (transportEquipmentId or transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber). You must specify one of these identifiers. If a transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber are specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

This event requires the eventOccurrenceTime8601.

When specifying a location, either the type/value field pair can be used, or any of the other location fields (unlocode, address, smdgTerminal, geoCoord, splc, gln), but not both. Any combination of the other location fields is supported. However, they must all refer to the same location. There is no cross check validation for the fields.

The field 'terminal' and the location 'smdgTerminal' field are both ways to reference a terminal using the SMDG standard. When both are specified, the location 'smdgTerminal' field will take precedence. The 'terminal' field will be ignored.

post.description:
The indication that an event has occurred that changes the status of an equipment.  Events are defined by the combination of: 

* eventClassifier 

* transportMode 

* eventAction 

This event requires either a Transport Equipment identifier (transportEquipmentId or transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber) or a Consignment Identifier (consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber). You must specify one type of identifier or the other. If a transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber are specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 is required when eventClassifier = 'Planned' 

This event requires the eventOccurrenceTime8601.

This event requires either a Transport Equipment identifier (transportEquipmentId or transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber) or a Consignment Identifier (consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber). You must specify one type of identifier or the other. The field 'terminal' and the location 'smdgTerminal' field are both ways to reference a terminal using the SMDG standard. When both are specified, the location 'smdgTerminal' field will take precedence. The 'terminal' field will be ignored.

 A set of multiple planned events can be used to define the route of a consignment or transport equipment. The route is the set of ports and countries that the object goes through and determines which port and country subscriptions will receive events. In order to define a route, each planned event in the set needs the following three fields.

If a transportEquipmentRef or equipmentNumber are specified, either a carrierBookingNumber, a billOfLadingNumber, or carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber may also be included to help identify the correct transport equipment.

If fullStatus is 'empty' and a carrierBookingNumber and billOfLadingNumber are not specified, the event will not be processed.

This event requires the eventOccurrenceTime8601.

When specifying a location, either the type/value field pair can be used, or any of the other location fields (unlocode, address, smdgTerminal, geoCoord, splc, gln), but not both. Any combination of the other location fields is supported. However, they must all refer to the same location. There is no cross check validation for the fields.

The field 'terminal' and the location 'smdgTerminal' field are both ways to reference a terminal using the SMDG standard. When both are specified, the location 'smdgTerminal' field will take precedence. The 'terminal' field will be ignored.

 A set of multiple planned events can be used to define the route of a consignment or transport equipment. The route is the set of ports and countries that the object goes through and determines which port and country subscriptions will receive events. In order to define a route, each planned event in the set needs the following three fields. 


* The transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 is used to group the planned events into a set and must have the same value for every planned event in the set. If multiple sets of planned events are submitted (such as if the transport plan gets revised) the set with the greatest transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 will be used. 

* The transportPlanTotalNumber should be the number of events that the user will submit in the set. 

* The transportPlanSequenceNumber should be the index of this event in the set (starting at 1 and going up to TotalNumber). 


These fields are optional but MUST be set for the planned event to be used to calculate a route.

post.description:
Creates a new consignment, which should be created at the moment when a Booking or Work Order is confirmed by the carrier and indicates that the goods/consignment/equipment or means of transport has been booked. If the consignment already exists, the consignment will be updated with the information given, instead of creating a new consignment.

Consignments can be created by orgs of types Ocean Carrier, Feeder Operator, 3PL Agent, 4PL Agent (transport service intermediaries), Truck Operator, Rail Operator and Barge Operator (Inland Service Providers)

When specifying a booking data location, either the type/value field pair can be used, or any of the other location fields (unlocode, address, geoCoord, gln), but not both. Any combination of the other location fields is supported. However, they must all refer to the same location. There is no cross check validation for the fields.

parameters.description: See Model to the right for the full description of the data. Note that the Example Value is *not* a comprehensive list of all the fields. It is a subset meant to provide a minimum working example of the data needed.

post.description:
Sets a reference identifier for the consignment. A consignment can have multiple reference numbers, and submitting this event multiple times will result in multiple references being added to the consignment. Reference numbers allow participants to search based on identifiers that have meaning to them, like a PO number.

Please be aware that adding a reference via this API does not create an obligation for the Transport Service Provider or any other participant in the transport equipment tracking to consume the reference number in its own internal systems or use that reference number in any communications with you or other parties outside the TradeLens platform.

This event requires submission of either consignmentId or carrierBookingNumber. 

A list of supported reference types can be retrieved from Platform Constants /referenceTypes API

post.description:
Creates or updates Transport Equipment (TE), which represents an instance of usage of a piece of equipment used to hold, protect or secure cargo for logistics purposes, most commonly a shipping container. The TE is associated with the consignment via the physical ID of the TE and the unique ID of the consignment. Whether a new TE is created or updated depends on the equipmentNumber and the carrierBookingNumber:

1) If there is no existing transport equipment with the equipmentNumber, a new TE will be created with the equipment number and it will be associated with the consignment that has the matching carrierBookingNumber.

2) If there is an existing TE with the equipment number and it is already associated with the consignment with the carrierBookingNumber, then the org that sent this event is checked. If the org that sent the event is the same as the org that created the TE, then the TE’s equipmentType and harmonizedCodes will be updated. If the org is not the same, nothing is done.

3) If there is an existing TE with the equipment number and it is NOT associated with the consignment with the carrierBookingNumber, then the TE is checked to see whether it is already associated with a consignment that is in the same consignment hierarchy as the consignment with the carrierBookingNumber. If it is, the existing TE is associated with the consignment that has the carrierBookingNumber, and the TE’s equipmentType and harmonizedCodes will be updated. If it is not, then a new TE will be created with the equipmentNumber and it will be associated with the consignment that has the carrierBookingNumber.

The "transferFromConsignment" field allows the publisher the ability to move a transport equipment from one consignment to another. The identifiers contained in the field specify the consignment that the transport equipment is being transferred from. The identifiers specified in the main body of this event describe the consignment the transport equipment is being transferred to. The publisher may specify:

* A carrierBookingNumber

* A carrierBookingNumber and a billOfLadingNumber

* A consignmentId

The publisher cannot specify only a billOfLadingNumber nor are they allowed to specify both a carrierBookingNumber and a consignmentId. It must be one or the other.

Transport Equipment can be created by orgs of types Ocean Carrier, Feeder Operator, 3PL Agent, 4PL Agent (transport service intermediaries), Truck Operator, Rail Operator and Barge Operator (Inland Service Providers)

post.description:
Used to add reference numbers to an instance of Transport Equipment. Multiple references can be registered against the same Transport Equipment. The references are applied to the trade object and will become visible and searchable by all participants that are permissioned to access it.

Please be aware that adding a reference via this API does not create an obligation for the Transport Service Provider or any other participant in the transport equipment tracking to consume the reference number in its own internal systems or use that reference number in any communications with you or other parties outside the TradeLens platform.

This event requires either a transportEquipmentId or equipmentNumber. If an equipmentNumber is specified, a carrierBookingNumber may also be included.

A list of supported reference types can be retrieved from Platform Constants /referenceTypes API

eventSubmissionGpsLocation.description: GPS coordinates of where the event originated from (mobile device only)

equipmentNumber.description: The identification found on the transport equipment

transportEquipmentId.description: Generated ID for the transport equipment.  This should be the value returned by the Start equipment tracking event

transportEquipmentRef.description: Reference to an existing transport equipment.  Value should be very unique and created by a user

transportPlanIssuanceTime8601.description: A timestamp used to group planned events that make up a Transport Plan, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ . This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanTotalNumber.description: The total number of events in the group of planned events that make up this Transport Plan, that is, the number of events with the same transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 that will be submitted as part of this transport plan. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

eventOccurrenceTime8601.description: When the event occurred, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ

location.description: The location where the event occurred (or will occur)

transportationPhase.description: Transportation phase indicates whether an event occurs during the export, transshipment, or import phase relative to a given consignment. The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

terminal.description: UNLOCODE-Terminal Code (including hyphen in between). This is the full SMDG code.

vehicleId.description: ID of truck, rail, barge, or vessel

vehicleName.description: Name of truck, rail, barge, or vessel

description.description: A description of the document passed by URI

contentUrl.description: A URI pointing to a copy of the document

docId.description: The ID of this document in Platform - used by Platform to reconstruct the document URI. Most users will not need to set this field.

docVersion.description: The version of this document in Platform

docReferences.description: List of references, formerly unique in a subset of doc events

transportEquipmentId.description: Generated ID for the transport equipment.  This should be the value returned by the Start equipment tracking event

transportEquipmentRef.description: Reference to an existing transport equipment.  Value should be very unique and created by a user

The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

transportPlanIssuanceTime8601.description: A timestamp used to group planned events that make up a Transport Plan, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ . This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanTotalNumber.description: The total number of events in the group of planned events that make up this Transport Plan, that is, the number of events with the same transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 that will be submitted as part of this transport plan. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transferFromConsignment.description: The Consignment from which to transfer an existing Transport Equipment. If this is set, we will search for a TE with provided pid that is associated with a consignment matching the identifiers provided below. If we find one, we will transfer that TE from its current consignment to the one with the cbn provided in the event. Otherwise, we will create a new TE

transferFromEquipment.description: This is an equipment number of a Transport Equipment object that will be updated with the equipment number specified by ‘equipmentNumber’ field. transportationPhase.description: Transportation phase indicates whether an event occurs during the export, transshipment, or import phase relative to a given consignment. The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

transportPlanIssuanceTime8601.description: A timestamp used to group planned events that make up a Transport Plan, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ . This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanTotalNumber.description: The total number of events in the group of planned events that make up this Transport Plan, that is, the number of events with the same transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 that will be submitted as part of this transport plan. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportationPhase.description: Transportation phase indicates whether an event occurs during the export, transshipment, or import phase relative to a given consignment. The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

terminal.description: UNLOCODE-Terminal Code (including hyphen in between). This is the full SMDG code.

vehicleId.description: ID of truck, rail, barge, or vessel

vehicleName.description: Name of truck, rail, barge, or vessel

transportEquipmentRef.description: Reference to an existing transport equipment.  Value should be very unique and created by a user

transportPlanIssuanceTime8601.description: A timestamp used to group planned events that make up a Transport Plan, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ . This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanTotalNumber.description: The total number of events in the group of planned events that make up this Transport Plan, that is, the number of events with the same transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 that will be submitted as part of this transport plan. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportationPhase.description: Transportation phase indicates whether an event occurs during the export, transshipment, or import phase relative to a given consignment. The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

transportPlanTotalNumber.description: The total number of events in the group of planned events that make up this Transport Plan, that is, the number of events with the same transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 that will be submitted as part of this transport plan. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. transportationPhase.description: Transportation phase indicates whether an event occurs during the export, transshipment, or import phase relative to a given consignment. The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

transportPlanIssuanceTime8601.description: A timestamp used to group planned events that make up a Transport Plan, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ . This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanTotalNumber.description: The total number of events in the group of planned events that make up this Transport Plan, that is, the number of events with the same transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 that will be submitted as part of this transport plan. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

"Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". transportationPhase.description: Transportation phase indicates whether an event occurs during the export, transshipment, or import phase relative to a given consignment. The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

transportPlanTotalNumber.description: The total number of events in the group of planned events that make up this Transport Plan, that is, the number of events with the same transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 that will be submitted as part of this transport plan. transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. transportPlanIssuanceTime8601.description: A timestamp used to group planned events that make up a Transport Plan, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ . This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanTotalNumber.description: The total number of events in the group of planned events that make up this Transport Plan, that is, the number of events with the same transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 that will be submitted as part of this transport plan. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

eventOccurrenceTime8601.description: When the event occurred, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ

location.description: The location where the event occurred (or will occur)

transportationPhase.description: Transportation phase indicates whether an event occurs during the export, transshipment, or import phase relative to a given consignment. The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

terminal.description: UNLOCODE-Terminal Code (including hyphen in between). This is the full SMDG code.

vehicleId.description: ID of truck, rail, barge, or vessel

vehicleName.description: Name of truck, rail, barge, or vessel

transportPlanIssuanceTime8601.description: A timestamp used to group planned events that make up a Transport Plan, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ . This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanTotalNumber.description: The total number of events in the group of planned events that make up this Transport Plan, that is, the number of events with the same transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 that will be submitted as part of this transport plan. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

eventOccurrenceTime8601.description: When the event occurred, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ

location.description: The location where the event occurred (or will occur)

transportationPhase.description: Transportation phase indicates whether an event occurs during the export, transshipment, or import phase relative to a given consignment. The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

"Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

terminal.description: UNLOCODE-Terminal Code (including hyphen in between). This is the full SMDG code.

vehicleId.description: ID of truck, rail, barge, or vessel

vehicleName.description: Name of truck, rail, barge, or vessel

originatorId.description: The party identification code (i.e. SCAC) of the organization publishing the event

eventSubmissionTime.description: Time of submission, as the number of milliseconds since Epoch

eventSubmissionTime8601.description: Time of submission, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ

eventSubmissionGpsLocation.description: GPS coordinates of where the event originated from (mobile device only)

equipmentNumber.description: The identification found on the transport equipment

transportEquipmentId.description: Generated ID for the transport equipment.  This should be the value returned by the Start equipment tracking event

transportEquipmentRef.description: Reference to an existing transport equipment.  Value should be very unique and created by a user

eventOccurrenceTime8601.description: When the event occurred, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ

location.description: The location where the event occurred (or will occur)

terminal.description: The terminal where the event will occur to satisfy this cut off

cutOffDateTime8601.description: Deadline for the cut off, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ . If possible, this should be specified in the time zone where the event is expected to occur

cutOffEventType.description: Name of the event endpoint that must be received to satisfy this cut off. As an example, for the cutOffType "VGM", you might set cutOffEventType to "vgmSubmitted"

   }, 
   "terminal": null 
}

transportationPhase.description: Transportation phase indicates whether an event occurs during the export, transshipment, or import phase relative to a given consignment. The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanTotalNumber.description: The total number of events in the group of planned events that make up this Transport Plan, that is, the number of events with the same transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 that will be submitted as part of this transport plan. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. transportationPhase.description: Transportation phase indicates whether an event occurs during the export, transshipment, or import phase relative to a given consignment. The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".

transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. eventSubmissionGpsLocation.description: GPS coordinates of where the event originated from (mobile device only)

equipmentNumber.description: The identification found on the transport equipment

transportEquipmentId.description: Generated ID for the transport equipment.  This should be the value returned by the Start equipment tracking event

transportEquipmentRef.description: Reference to an existing transport equipment.  Value should be very unique and created by a user

eventOccurrenceTime8601.description: When the event occurred, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ

location.description: The location where the event occurred (or will occur)

transportPlanIssuanceTime8601.description: A timestamp used to group planned events that make up a Transport Plan, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ . This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanTotalNumber.description: The total number of events in the group of planned events that make up this Transport Plan, that is, the number of events with the same transportPlanIssuanceTime8601 that will be submitted as part of this transport plan. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

transportPlanSequenceNumber.description: The index of this event in the group of planned events that make up its Transport Plan. Indexing should start at 1. This field must be set in every planned event in the transport plan for the transport equipment to calculate a dynamic route using this transport plan

eventOccurrenceTime8601.description: When the event occurred, in common ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ

location.description: The location where the event occurred (or will occur)

transportationPhase.description: Transportation phase indicates whether an event occurs during the export, transshipment, or import phase relative to a given consignment. The distinction is based on the ocean legs of the consignment's transport plan. Thus, "export" relates to any events occurring up until and including the vessel departure of the first ocean leg. "Import" relates to last vessel arrival and all subsequent events. All events which may occur in between export and import are marked as "transshipment". If the transport plan origin and destination countries are the same, all events are marked "domestic".
